core.grammar
Interface Derivation

All Known Implementing Classes:
DerivationImpl
public interface Derivation

The inteface declares the methods that define the responsabilities of a Derivation object. It belongs to the Public API.

Author:
Jorge Couchet

Method Detail

getMaxRandomDerivation

Derivation getMaxRandomDerivation(int maxDepthGlobal,
                                  NonTerminal nt)
                                  throws GrammarExceptionImpl,
                                         GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl
Returns a new Grammar's Derivation, using the symbol nt as the starting point, that is: the Productions that have nt as the left symbol are selected, and one of them is selected in a random way. Next, the Non Terminals at the right side of the Production selected, are used as starting point, an so on, until only Terminal symbols are generated and the Derivation is complete. The method getRandomDerivation (without a maximum depth), isn't implemented because it can consume the machine's memory. But the method can be simulated with the method getMaxRandomDerivation with a big value in the parameter maxDepthGlobal. It's important to note that the Derivation generated for the function have a depth's maximum (maxDepthGlobal), that is: the Productions are selected in a random way, but if the production selected generates a Derivation that surpasses the maxDepthGlobal, the Production selected and the Derivation generated are discarded and a new Production is selected. The details of the algorithm used is given in the paper: "Crossover and Mutation Operators for Grammar-Guided Genetic Programming", by the authors: Jorge Couchet, Daniel Manrique, Juan Ríos and Alfonso Rodríguez-Patón.

Parameters:
maxDepthGlobal - The depth's maximum that a Derivation is allow to reach.
nt - The Grammar's Non Terminal symbol used as starting point to generate a new Derivation.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl
GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl

getMaxRandomDerivationWithFunction

Derivation getMaxRandomDerivationWithFunction(int maxDepthGlobal,
                                              NonTerminal nt,
                                              java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> features,
                                              Function F,
                                              java.lang.String s,
                                              int s2_pos)
                                              throws GrammarExceptionImpl,
                                                     GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl
The function has the same behavior that the function "getMaxRandomDerivation", and it has been added with the following additional feature: given an Element (e) with the symbol "s" associated, the function adds to the Derivation's e node the following two items: 1) A new function f, that is obtained through the parameter F ( F.createFunction ). The created function f will be applied over the node. 2) A value (v) calculated in the following way: the e node is generated by a production P, where the e is at the right side. At the right side of P must be at least one Element more (e2), that must be a Terminal symbol. Then v is calculated as: v = features.get(e2.getSymbol). That is, the value is the double associated in the map "features" to the Element e2. The Element e2 is selected using the absolute position s2_pos.

Parameters:
maxDepthGlobal - The depth's maximum that a Derivation is allow to reach.
nt - The Grammar's Non Terminal symbol used as starting point to generate a new Derivation.
features - The mapping to be used to add the value v to the node that has an Element with a symbol "s".
F - The function f = F.createFunction will be added to the node that has an Element with a symbol "s".
s - The symbol to be used to select the Derivation's nodes to which add the function "f" and the value "v". A null function is added if the node with the element e (that has associated the symbol "s") is the root.
s2_pos - The absolute position of the node with the element e2 is obtained: abs_pos_node_with_element_e + s2_pos. This node must be at the same level of the node with the element e. Remember that the absolute positions of the nodes start at 0. If the obtained position for the node with the element e2 is invalid, a null function is added to this node.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl
GrammarMaxDepthExceptionImpl

crossoverGBX

Derivation[] crossoverGBX(Derivation d1,
                          Derivation d2,
                          int maxDepthGlobal)
                          throws GrammarExceptionImpl
The function implements a merge of two m-Trees, using the GBX algorithm described in "Crossover and Mutation Operators for Grammar-Guided Genetic Programming" as a guide.

Parameters:
d1 - The first Derivation (m-Tree) used for the merge.
d2 - The second Derivation (m-Tree) used for the merge.
maxDepthGlobal - The new m-Trees generated by the merge aren't allowed to surpass the depth maxDepthGlobal.
Returns:
Two new Trees generated by the merge between the m-Trees d1 and d2.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

crossoverGBXWithFunction

Derivation[] crossoverGBXWithFunction(Derivation d1,
                                      Derivation d2,
                                      int maxDepthGlobal,
                                      java.lang.String s)
                                      throws GrammarExceptionImpl
The function has the same behavior that the function "crossoverGBX", and it has been added with the following additional feature: it updates the nodes that have an Element with a symbol "s" (those nodes have associated a function f and a value v). The node's update is the following: the function f associated to the node is updated ( f2 =f.updateFunction ), and f2 (that sustitutes f in the node), is applied over v ( v2 = f2.applyFuntion[v] ), and the returning new value v2, sustitutes v in the node.

Parameters:
d1 - The first Derivation (m-Tree) used for the merge.
d2 - The second Derivation (m-Tree) used for the merge.
maxDepthGlobal - The new m-Trees generated by the merge aren't allowed to surpass the depth maxDepthGlobal.
s - The symbol to be used to select the Derivation's nodes that have associatet the function "f" and the value "v".
Returns:
Two new Trees generated by the merge between the m-Trees d1 and d2.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

crossByLevels

void crossByLevels()
The function prints for each m-Tree's level (from the level 1 to maximum level), the nodes from the left to the right (a new level is started when the nodes from the level before are finished). The information printed for each node is the associated symbol and the production that generates the node.

crossByLevelsWithFunction

void crossByLevelsWithFunction(java.lang.String s)
The function prints for each m-Tree's level (from the level 1 to maximum level), the nodes from the left to the right (a new level is started when the nodes from the level before are finished). The information printed for each node is the associated symbol, the function (if the node has one) operator and increment, the value associated to the node, and the production that generates the node.

Parameters:
s - The node's symbol of the nodes with a Function.

depth

int depth()
The function returns the maximum level (the root is at the level 1) of the m-Tree that is the Derivation.

duplicateDerivation

Derivation duplicateDerivation(int level,
                               int absRank)
                               throws GrammarExceptionImpl
As a Derivation is a m-Tree, the Tree has levels . The level start with 1 (the root has the level 1, all the root's direct childs have level 2, and so on). Each node in a level has a relative rank and an absolute rank, for example if the root (level 1) has two direct childs A and B (at the level 2), and these childs have the childs A1, A2 (at the level 3), and B1, B2 (at the level 3) respectively. The child A1 has the relative (regards his parent) rank 0, and the absolute (regards his level) rank 0, the child A2 has the relative rank 1, and the absolute rank 1, the child B1 has the relative rank 0, and the absolute rank 2, and the child B2 has the relative rank 1 and the absolute rank 3. It's important to note that is possible to find without ambiguity any node of a m-Tree with his level and absolute rank (these numbers are the node's coordinates in the Tree). The function creates a new Tree, that is a duplicate of the subtree that starts with the node located at the given level and absolute rank (the new Tree has these node as a root).

Parameters:
level - The level where the node to be used as a root is located.
absRank - The absolute rank (regards the given level) where the node to be used as a root is located.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getLevelsRanks

void getLevelsRanks(Element e)
Given an Derivation's Element (e), the function prints where is located in the m-Tree that is the Derivation. The location is given for the level and absolute rank's Element (e).

Parameters:
e - The Derivation's Element for whom its position is calculated.

getLeavesInLeftOrder

java.util.Collection<Element> getLeavesInLeftOrder()
                                                   throws GrammarExceptionImpl
As a Derivation is a m-Tree (a Tree where each node has several nodes), the function returns the Derivation's leaves from left to right.

Returns:
A Collection with the Derivation'leaves from left to right.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getLeavesInLeftOrderWithFunction

java.util.Collection<Element> getLeavesInLeftOrderWithFunction(java.lang.String s)
                                                               throws GrammarExceptionImpl
As a Derivation is a m-Tree (a Tree where each node has several nodes), the function returns the Derivation's leaves from left to right.

Parameters:
s - For the leaves which has an element "e" with the symbol "s" associated, the function substitutes the element "e" for a new element "e2" which has as a symbol the value associated to the element "e".
Returns:
A Collection with the Derivation'leaves from left to right.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

getSignature

java.lang.Double getSignature()
Returns an unique number that identifies biunivocally the Derivation. Returns null if the signature wasn´t calculated. It is a mapping function between the Derivation space and the Real space.

clearDerivation

void clearDerivation()
                     throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Clear the structures used by the Derivation Object.

Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl

clearDerivationWithFunction

void clearDerivationWithFunction(java.lang.String symbol)
                                 throws GrammarExceptionImpl
Clear the structures used by the Derivation Object.

Parameters:
symbol - The symbol associated to a node with a Function.
Throws:
GrammarExceptionImpl
